attributes.action: Reform GDPR/Data Law with Automatic Fines on Bodies/Organisations not Complying
attributes.background: Since the GDPR was updated in May 2018 some public bodies/organisations still do not comply. Reform GDPR/Data Law to impose Automatic Daily Fines for failure to respond/comply with a data request within 1 month. If any records are withhold an automatic fine of the ICO maximum of £500,000 must apply
attributes.additional_details: If public bodies/organisations wish to recover some of the costs of the fines they will have to appeal to court to prove which information is being withheld/concealed from individuals & why, how the information was gathered & generated or records contaminated. If proven there is an attempt to obstruct justice those involved should be ordered to pay towards the fine/costs. We must have accountability across our public services, every individual in the UK is entitled to access to all their records

attributes.action: Make it non-compulsory for students to pay for a tv license
attributes.background: If students can prove that a tv license has been paid for at their home address there should be no need to pay for a license at their student accommodation.
attributes.additional_details: Currently students do not have to pay council tax at student accommodation, this should also apply for tv license.

attributes.action: Make on-line gambling illegal
attributes.background: 24-hour easy access to on-line gambling exacerbates the tragic results of people gambling beyond their means. Ban it completely, by making on-line gambling illegal in the UK
attributes.additional_details: The well-publicised explosion in on-line gambling illustrates how vast fortunes are made by small numbers of owners, at the expense of huge numbers of vulnerable gamblers, including the young and those who can ill afford to spend on gambling. Gambling profits come from one single source: the gamblers' losses. It causes hardship, family rifts, depression and suicides. On-line gambling specifically presents easy opportunities 24/7/365 for people to succumb to temptation to bet beyond their means, without even leaving their homes, and without regard for consequences. There is only one effective solution, which is to ban on-line gambling completely, by making it illegal in the UK

attributes.action: Change Planning Laws on Fences to require a 300mm Hole on each side for Wildlife
attributes.background: Today most New Houses have FULLY enclosed rear gardens with high fences down to the ground, seeing our Wildlife is in Decline it makes sense to help them out with these Holes so they can Roam around as they should, Humans have and keep taking away their Habitat, Hedgehogs for one do a lot of good.
attributes.additional_details:
Concrete Gravel Boards need to have one Manufactured with a Hole, wooden fences need the same when sat on the ground, Humans must try to Protect Wildlife for future Generations or we are Selfish.
 
Please Support this as our Wildlife would Appreciate it.

attributes.action: SELECTIVE licensing for tenants should be removed or applied for all landlords.
attributes.background:
SELECTIVE licensing for certain areas and certain landlords is unfair.

The law should be same for all where ever you live in the country.

This should also be applied to letting agencies and housing estates.
attributes.additional_details:
Lisence is applied when you commence a business and require authority of the council this should be same for everyone not selective.

Also the law should be applied to council areas not privately owned.

Safety of tenants can also be address in many other ways.

We are all equal in England and the law should be passed for all not few.

attributes.action: Require differential off-peak electricity rates.
attributes.background: The energy companies have eroded the differential between the night time and day time electricity tariffs, originally introduced to provide competition to other providers of energy, such as oil and gas.
attributes.additional_details: The recent hikes in off-peak rates for electricity have made heating homes for users of storage heaters, in particular, very difficult. Many people, often pensioners, invested in this form of central heating years ago and would find a change to oil (or gas if available) central heating prohibitive.

attributes.action: UK to sign the United Nations Convention on Migrants’ Rights
attributes.background:
The International Convention on the Protection of the Rights
of All Migrant Workers and Members of Their Families is a United Nations multilateral treaty governing the protection of migrant workers and families. It has still not been signed by the UK despite being adopted by General Assembly 1990.
attributes.additional_details: https://www.ohchr.org/en/professionalinterest/pages/cmw.aspx

attributes.action: More Money For Unemployed
attributes.background: Unemployed People Like Myself Struggle To Put Food On The Table. Afford Gas And Electric And Rent Top Ups. We Should Get Additional Support From DWP

attributes.action: Remove disability exemptions for the armed forces from the 2010 Equality Act
attributes.background: I was recently rejected by the Lancaster UOTC because of my Autism even though during their selection day in Liverpool I passed all their selection tests and completed all the required paperwork. They rejected me because I declared that I had a medical condition (Autism)
attributes.additional_details:
They rejected me because I declared on one of the medical forms that I have a medical condition (Autism). I had to declare it as it was a legal requirement. 
 
https://apply.army.mod.uk/how-to-join/can-i-join/medical
 
Autism is not included, yet on other British Army medical forms, one must disclose their Autism, and in turn they can be discriminated against because of this due to the exemption from parts of the Equality Act 2010.

attributes.action: Reduce the age of buying beer and alco-pops 5% and under, wine under 13% to 16
attributes.background: We would like the legal age of purchasing certain alcoholic beverages to the age of 16. By reducing the purchasing of beer and wine to 16 there will be less consumption of hard spirits as well as the use of counterfeit identification. This will promote a safer way for children to experiment.
attributes.additional_details: This theory is modelled on many European countries laws; Belgium, Germany and Spain. In 2016, 7,327 people died from alcohol related deaths of which many were caused by excessive drinking of spirits. The countries current legislation promotes the use of spirits for underage teenagers to become intoxicated. So by legalising a safer alternative to consume alcohol, which is an inevitability, there will be a decrease in alcohol related medical conditions in underage teenagers.

attributes.action: Consider funding a northern bypass for Ipswich.
attributes.background: The Orwell bridge. A14. Major artery from the expanding port of felixstowe. When the bridge gets closed in either direction due to bad weather, usually high winds, or a road traffic incident. All traffic is diverted through Ipswich town which causes absolute mayhem.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-england-suffolk-44656588

One particular day the wind brought down trees and blocked local roads which were already congested due to tge bridge closure. This particular day it took me 90 minutes to get to work, 7 miles away...! There was an idea of allowing cars only in high winds but surely that would pose health and safefy issues.

attributes.action: Change 30 hours free child care eligible 51 weeks a year instead of term time
attributes.background: Current funding of 30 free hours only covers term time which for most working parents only actually covers maybe a day and a half child care as like me most work full time meaning if you have more then 1 child costs soon add up.  get the government to change 30hours free a week not just in term

attributes.action: Ban cot bumpers and baby sleeping aids from being sold in the UK
attributes.background:
Every year babies die in cots where parents use bumpers and positional sleeping aids. These deaths are unnecessary and many are avoidable. 

The recommendations for safe sleep do not include these items and many parents are misinformed in the safety of these.

attributes.action: Better treatment for NHS dialysis patients
attributes.background:
Government figures. I If a patient enters dialysis after the age of 
70to 75 life expectancy is 1 to 2 years. I entered at the age of 82 I am now in my 7th year.
attributes.additional_details:
Kidney failure
This petition could apply to any person of any age. 
I never had kidney failure, I had two operations 12 years apart each operation killed one kidney. 	 
I diagnosed myself and informed the doctor in writing more than a dozen times when I had a closure of an artery,  
There is a system for detecting closures it’s called a transonic flow meter it is used on patients once every three months? 
My petition is for the flow meter to be used on the patient four times a month with a minimum of twice a month.
It will mean patients living longer but that is what nursing is all about? 
Please sign this petition, you will be helping others and by unfortunate chance you might be helping your self.

attributes.action: Set up a single tribunal service for all public services complaints/ grievances.
attributes.background: Call on the government to create a fair free tribunal body and procedure to hear complaints/grievances/appeals relating to failure, mistakes or misuse of power by those in all public services who conceal their wrongdoing.
attributes.additional_details:
The impact to people affected is simply being normalised and accepted as the way things are.

The public must have a right to a fair tribunal service & charter which allows their concerns to be heard when they have suffered failure/mistakes & gives the tribunal more powers to compel witnesses/public officers to testify. The public’s rights matter & they must be entitled to free access to justice & due process in disputes before an impartial judge as those in public office can use public money to conceal failure/mistakes & those affected have no voice & most cannot access legal assistance.

attributes.action: Make Michaelmas Day (29th September) a public holiday.
attributes.background:
Michaelmas (Mickle-mas) was The Feast of St Michael and was used to celebrate the final harvest.  Everything that couldn't be preserved was eaten in a great feast.

This holiday would be a dress rehearsal for Christmas, minus the relatives and presents!

attributes.action: Require fire evacuation and lockdown drills in UK schools and colleges
attributes.background: I am very interested in health and safety and I want to feel like I make a difference to this country by making our schools and colleges a safer environment for staff and students by carrying out fire evacuations termly and a lockdown procedure test at least once a year.

attributes.action: Income Tax changes to be more diverse either individual or per house hold
attributes.background: Currently income tax works on an individual basis, therefore if a household has two workers at 35k they both pay 20% tax each, however in a family with children only one adult works they are penalised after 46k,
attributes.additional_details:
Council tax and other taxes work on the basis of per house hold so why not for Income Tax, changing this to a per household rate allowing partners to absorb/ utilise the tax allowance prior to the increase to 40% and/or 50%. 

Example could be: Adult 1 salary 20k, Adult 2 salary 60k tax would only increase to 40% once 80k mark has hit, this would aide families where only one parent is working and/ or coupled adults living under a single roof

attributes.action: Ban Saturday school in all private schools to make the systems fair
attributes.background: Many private schools have Saturday school and many others don’t. Saturday school is a huge effort and much more money for parents to spend on their education. As a student you need rest and Saturday school does not allow this.

attributes.action: Reduce the amount of homework received by primary school students.
attributes.background: Being a student myself, I know the struggle. Children in primary education receive an unnecessary amount of homework each week, and need to be enjoying their childhood, and being more active. The only important homework is reading and spellings.
attributes.additional_details: Some of the homework they receive is sometimes difficult to understand, and not always relevant to their learning. Not only do the students feel pressurised at such a young age, but it can also cause conflict at home between the student and their parents. This is due to the parents also feeling stressed.

attributes.action: Require all dog breeders to keep a correct record of Dogs chipped and sold on.
attributes.background: Today 5 Dogs caught as strays....have a chip no. but either not registered or no longer a current contact.

attributes.action: Add Middle Rate Mobility for children receiving Disability Living Allowance
attributes.background:
My 10 year daughter has hyper mobility type Ehlers Danlos Syndrome, she has low muscle tone, subluxations of joints, swelling of joints, widespread joint pain to name a few symptoms. 
She has ankle braces, insoles, a wheelchair and other aids to help but she has never been entitled to mobility.
attributes.additional_details:
There is 3 rates of care but only 2 for mobility and the criterias for 2 rates don’t accomadate for children like my daughter. 
For LRM the criteria is the child needs ‘guidance or supervision with walking on unfamiliar routes’ and for HRM the criteria is the child must be unable to walk, virtually unable to walk, have no legs or feet, be SMI, be SVI, be blind and deaf or be a danger to them self. There should be an in between for children who have days where they need a wheelchair etc.

attributes.action: Require schools to sell logos to sew on to uniforms
attributes.background: Uniform costs are rising and parents are having to worry about meeting these costs. If schools were made to sell their logos to sew onto cheaper alternatives this would alleviate a massive burden. Instead of paying £50 for a blazer cheaper ones are available at a fraction of the cost etc.

attributes.action: Ban the use of full names in GP or hospital waiting rooms
attributes.background: Confidentiality is up most important in settings such as GP surgeries and hospitals. Data protection laws are tougher now than ever. However they don’t seem to apply when in a waiting room, the professional will call you through by using your full name in front of other people.
attributes.additional_details: I am starting this petition after a prisoner attached to their guard in a waiting room was called through for his appointment. All it took was for me to google their name and gather information as to why they were in prison, how long their sentence was and their address. People’s identities should be protected in GP and hospital waiting rooms.

attributes.action: Scrap the CQC as an onerous bombastic regulation lead organisation
attributes.background: The CQC and its predecessors have developed this watch dog role since 2004, and it’s worth asking what if anything, these state appointed monitors have contributed to health and social care during that time, apart from undermining leadership and interrupting health care delivery.
attributes.additional_details: I believe the CQC have made clear mistakes over recent years. It is clear that they are unlikely to change their methodology and a majority of health care professionals across the country think they are not fit for purpose, and wish to see a change in the way health and social care is regulated.

attributes.action: Require unused holiday pay to be paid to employees at end of every year service.
attributes.background: Many employees lose out of their full holiday pay mostly due to unable to take them depending on their job role. Employers are entitled to 5.6 weeks holiday a year. Sometimes requests get rejected by employers or can't use them all. All unused holiday play should be paid at end of the holiday year.
attributes.additional_details: I've requested holidays to be used in quiet periods and most the time I don't get them and end up losing atleast half my holiday pay aswell as many others. What's the point in entitling employees 5.6 weeks a year but they don't get the full holidays they are entitled to. These unused holidays should be paid to employees at the end of every working year as its unfair if the employer does not usage them and in turn we lose out on what we are entitled to every year.  Scrap the "don't use you lose"

attributes.action: Make a mandatory minimum sentence for child sex offenders
attributes.background:
To many sex offenders get let of with community punishment orders ect I think there should be more of a deterrent and a mandatory minimum prison sentence. 
Also the public especially those with children should have acces to view if any registered sex offenders live in the area they reside.

attributes.action: Stop Cat D (open prisons) holding sex offenders within 5 miles of any school.
attributes.background: Safety for all our children. An open prison means prisoners can leave prison unescorted. Being near any school I feel this is asking for trouble and very dangerous.

attributes.action: Impose a 3 to 5% sales tax for online every day retail purchases- exc food, hols
attributes.background: Town centres are the beating heart of the community in Britain. As well as the environmental impact of ordering everything online, trying it on, sending it back etc big dominant US retailers take money out of the UK with unfair tax dodges. Let's boost the high street, or chancery coffers, with e-VAT

attributes.action: Stop the state pension reducing tax allowances for working pensioners
attributes.background: Many people remain in work beyond retirement age training the next generation. Some work because they need to top up their income rather than turn to the state for benefits. Decreasing tax codes re-taxes PAYBACK of money already paid in tax. This was not an investment but saving.
attributes.additional_details: What the government should do is change the law so the state pension doesn't count towards someone's personal tax allowance if they are working. Having completed one working career paying for that pension, the government should allow people to continue to work without having their tax code reduced. This double tax on pensions puts people off continuing to contribute to society. The well being of remaining part time in work reduces a burden on the state. State pension is a PAYBACK and not an additional income!

attributes.action: Make it a law that every work place need to supply air conditioning units.
attributes.background: Every work place now won’t supply air conditioning as it’s not Essential however if we made it a law many schools, nursurys and work places would Benefit.
attributes.additional_details:
There is no law which says you have to go home just that your work place has to supply water. 
Let’s make a change!

attributes.action: Change ‘national speed limit’ signs so they show the actual speed for that road
attributes.background: The current National speed limit signs are confusing for most drivers on our roads. If the signs were to display an actual speed limit for any given road this would take away any uncertainty.

attributes.action: Outlaw councils from banning dogs from public beaches in England and Wales.
attributes.background: Most dog owners pick up their dog waste and control their  dogs. People work all week or all even year for those magic moments on a beach with their family and dog, only to find dogs are not allowed on many beaches in England and Wales.
attributes.additional_details: More litter/dog wardens could be employed giving offenders high on the spot fines.

attributes.action: Explain how Juvenile Covert Human Intelligence Sources are used & kept safe.
attributes.background:
It was recently reported that the government use what they describe as Juvenile Covert Human Intelligence Sources (otherwise known as children) are used in intelligence services. 

If a government is willing to put children at risk the public deserve to know why, when and how they are kept safe.

attributes.action: To review current criminal law relating to rape and sexual offences.
attributes.background:
I would like the government to review current law and to implement a 3-point plan.

Educate - To make sexual education compulsory in all Secondary schools.
Prevent - Increased awareness around high-risk areas (nightclubs, pubs etc).
Prosecute - Increase current minimum term guideline for crimes.
attributes.additional_details:
I believe more can be done to reduce crime relating to rape and sexual offences. I am constantly heartbroken, daily, to read about it on the news. The crime is unforgivable and I think we have a duty as a society to call for more action which will protect the general public. 

- Approximately 85,000 women and 12,000 men are raped in England and Wales alone every year.
- Rape Crisis specialist services were accessed by 78,461 individuals an increase of 17% from 2016-17.

attributes.action: digital tachographs and cpc for private hire vehicles
attributes.background: I would like to see a more professional approach to granting taxi and private hire vehicle licences. The introduction of a digital tachograph into all private hire vehicles and taxi's would create a safer environment for passengers,pedestrians and other road users.
attributes.additional_details: My idea might not be perfect and there may be better technology to monitor the drivers of the vehicles.However I think it would identify a massive black economy. Identifying who is actually driving the vehicle , and the hours they are working. The introduction of a CPC (certificate of professional competence) would be a minimum requirement to send a message to this business sector to improve the standard of driving.

attributes.action: Allow fathers in employment to have time off for scans and parenting classes
attributes.background: First time dad. Gov.co.uk states maximum two appointments for scans etc. Employers shouldn’t be allowed to force dads to use their holidays for scan appointments. As fathers we should be allowed every appointment off work.
attributes.additional_details: My partner and I have to go to various hospitals for scans to ensure everything is right. I must use my holiday hours. I can take time off for a doctors or hospital appointment, because it's for me but I can’t have time off for scans because it's not directly for me! Slight discrimination!”

attributes.action: Alter "laws" that bar certain Brits from jobs with the Secret Service.
attributes.background: The Home Office, FCO, MI5,MI6,HMGCC & other Gov’ Offices reject applicants simply because they don’t have a British Parent with British ties; even if they have a Naturalization Certificate and a British Passport. That these documents do “NOT” make one British enough to be appointed is unacceptable!
attributes.additional_details: Evidence is the Criterium openly set out as advertised on the Foreign Offices’ websites and MI5, MI6, also enshrined in UK Law.

attributes.action: Ban the selling and open displaying of Golliwog dolls in UK stores.
attributes.background: Golliwog dolls depict a racially insulting charactater of black people. This is no longer acceptable. Sign the petition and let the goverment know, how the UK really feels about the legal selling and displaying of Golliwog dolls.
attributes.additional_details:
The Golliwog character has long been used in childrens literature, to denigrate black people. The use of the racial word "wog" originates from this ignorant depiction of black people.

It's time for all people to make clear that the selling of these racially provocative dolls, needs to stop.

The displaying of such dolls on store front windows, has to stop.

Share and sign this petition.

attributes.action: Make it mandatory to have a licence to breed pets
attributes.background: A licence to breed pets will enable Britain to be the real nation of animal lovers it so claims to be! Licensing would show that a person is breeding a pet for the right reasons, not just for money, breeding an animal for good reasons like bringing out the heredity problems in breeds.
attributes.additional_details:
In 2017, Battersea dogs home took in 3,373 dogs but only 2,249 rehomed! That leaves over 1,000 dogs without a place to call home. Stop pets being left behind in kennels, catteries and animal shelters. I hope by making people have a licence to breed pets it will reduce the numbers that the animal shelters are crowded by. 
I also hope it will stop animals from being left at the side of the road. 
This in turn will make more people buy a rescue animal instead of a home bread animal.

attributes.action: Renumber the A1(M) from Leeds to Newcastle as the M1
attributes.background: As the A1 has now been upgraded to motorway standard from Leeds to Newcastle for the entire length,to the A1(M), it would make more sense to renumber this section as t he M1, to create a continuous M1 motorway from London to Newcastle.
attributes.additional_details: Renumbering the A1(M) to the M1 would be enormously beneficial to the counties of Yorkshire, County Durham and Tyne and Wear.

attributes.action: Parents who do Not Exercise their Duties, should lose their Parental Rights!
attributes.background: I want the law to change by taking parental responsibility from inactive parents, this would give ease to the 'Actual' Responsible Parents. It would prevent parents who are not involved in their children’s’ lives taking decisions whether it’s good for their welfare or not.
attributes.additional_details:
Absent Parents having Parental Responsibility, creates more pain & stress for the Active parent, making decisions difficult, such as: 
-Whether or not a child has medical treatment. 
-Child’s name change 
-Consent for a child go holiday etc.
 
Like being a single hardworking parent isn't difficult enough, Imagine having to ask a careless or abusive ex for "permission", or the stress & cost of courts, having to explain why we shouldn't need to get permission from an "Absent" (by choice) parent.

attributes.action: Maintenance payments (inc Spousal) as an attachment of Earnings or via Court
attributes.background: When maintenance is not paid after a Court has ordered it it is wrong to have to keep going back to Court to enforce. Apart from the trauma that you go through for years in my case, and the cost which ran into thousands, why should you have to wait and fight again after an order is made
attributes.additional_details:
It is also a fact that the time it takes to enforce can put that person into even more debt, or the chance to lose their home when maintenance isn’t paid.
It is obvious the person isn’t going to want to pay, which is why it ends up in Court, so why is this not taken as an attachment of earnings or via Court within the order?
The system doesn’t allow for both parties to get on with their lives as it states is the purpose when the one side is always unsure of receiving what was fought for

attributes.action: Save Britain's Motorways from terrible driving with regular reminders.
attributes.background: Britain's Motorways are congested, but this isn't helped by terrible drivers. Slow driving and lane hogging can be worse than speeding. Speeding is policed with signs and fines. Do the same and regularly remind drivers on digital displays and bridges to speed up or keep left. Simple but effective.
attributes.additional_details:
https://metro.co.uk/2018/12/29/crashes-caused-drivers-going-slow-soar-third-8290610/

Personal experience of driving on Britain's roads.

attributes.action: Pay all employed Carers the Living Wage
attributes.background: Caring, in our life time we will all require a need for caring, either for ourselves or for a person close to us. Carers need to work on Person-Centred Care principals via the Care Support Plan.
attributes.additional_details:
Their responsibilities are intimate personal care, washing, dressing, meal preparation, Financial management, Emotional support, Safeguarding, Daily planning, Social inclusion, Wellbeing, respect and dignity in a personalised, dignified manner, respect for property and items within that property. National Living Wage is £7.83 and the Living Wage is £9.00. Pay rates need to reflect the responsibilities, pay Carers the Living Wage.

The Care Industry is hanging by a thread. In 2015, Carers UK found that Family Carers save the UK economy £132 billion a year and that if even a small proportion of Family Carers were unable to carry on caring, the economic effect would be “catastrophic”. We need to attract more people to the caring professional by paying the Living Wage.

attributes.action: Revive the Black Arrow rocket program to put the UK back into space.
attributes.background: From 1969-71, the UK launched a rocket named Black Arrow. The program was a success, but was unfortunately cancelled due to cost issues. Now with new technology and cheaper launch costs, it would be great to see this program revived to provide an alternative launch platform for sattelite companies.
attributes.additional_details: The Black Arrow saw four launches, with one placing the sattelite Prospero into an orbit around the earth. While the rocket saw two launch failures, it eventually ended up succeeding. Unfortunately, the program was cancelled in favour of using the cheaper US rockets to launch sattelites. With the growth of the space industry, and the advent of Brexit, a UK space program is needed. An updated version of Black Arrow will provide a cheaper alternative to the Ariane or Proton rockets used by Europe.

attributes.action: Enable the means to choose whether internet linked activities can be recorded.
attributes.background: I wish a simple, obvious setting to be shown on all devices used to connect to the internet to enable or prevent the harvesting of all data generated from any use of the internet unless required by law. It should be readily accessible to be turned on or off and take immediate effect.
attributes.additional_details: When Google updated it's Terms of Service, I checked what Google had recorded. It had recorded every search I had performed. Worse, the companies I had searched within, sent that data to Google. E.G. if within another company's web-site you click on a Google map, details go to Google. It goes much further. If I use my Android smart phone to take a picture, the software notifies Google! Anything Android processes goes to Google, payments, hotel bookings etc, they get to know everything - why?

attributes.action: Update food allergies laws to list allergens on menus in food establishments
attributes.background: In 2014, food allergies laws were passed for food establishments to tell customers if their food contains ingredients known to trigger allergies. It has recently become apparent staff don't always provide the correct information. An update is needed to make it compulsory for the info to be on menus

attributes.action: Nationalise UK mobile telephone masts.
attributes.background: 6 December 2018, O2 experienced a widespread failure affecting 20m+ UK customers. However other network providers continued to enjoy access. This petition would bring into public hands the network of phone masts, thus guaranteeing equality of access for customers.
attributes.additional_details:
Mobile data access is a key part of working and personal life for almost all people in the UK today. 

To have access for some and not for others when a network goes down is depriving large segments of the population with the ability to be productive, happy, and even safe.

It does not need to be this way, if the hardware of UK mobile data coverage was recognised as a natural monopoly and brought into public hands so it could also be managed in the public interest, all would be better off.

attributes.action: Change student loan arrangements to reflect career success
attributes.background:
The current arrangements reduce the incentive for students to achieve high-earning roles. Successful students see their debt increase every year until they are earning 4 x the average salary. 
Lower earners may never repay anything. This situation cannot be justified.
attributes.additional_details: The interest on the debt should be fixed at the no more than half a percent above the Bank of England rate when the loan is issued. Repayment should then be taken from all earnings/income (with no lower limit) at a rate that would pay the interest charges and reduce the outstanding balance. If students never work then the loan should be collected by a small reduction in any benefits.
